normalised: rental agreement jitters? don't panic, yaar!

mumbai's rental market is buzzing, but are you clued in on the latest rental agreement rules? landlords, tenants – listen up! forget outdated practices; it's all about registering those agreements online now!

unnormalised: Mumbai's rental market is buzzing, but are you clued in on the latest rental agreement rules? Landlords, tenants – listen up! Forget outdated practices; it's all about registering those agreements online now!
normalised: a recent survey by the d r ambedkar institute highlighted confusion around clauses relating to security deposits. many tenants are unaware that standard practice dictates a refundable deposit equivalent to two to three months' rent. make sure yours is clear, especially regarding deductions for wear and tear.

unnormalised: A recent survey by the Dr. Ambedkar Institute highlighted confusion around clauses relating to security deposits. Many tenants are unaware that standard practice dictates a refundable deposit equivalent to 2-3 months' rent. Make sure yours is clear, especially regarding deductions for wear and tear.
normalised: thinking of renting that cozy one b h k near bandra for rupee twenty five thousand? double-check the fine print! things like parking charges (often rupee one thousand five hundred extra!) and maintenance fees for the six hundred square foot space can add up.

unnormalised: Thinking of renting that cozy 1BHK near Bandra for Rs. 25,000? Double-check the fine print! Things like parking charges (often Rs. 1500 extra!) and maintenance fees for the 600 sq ft space can add up.
normalised: pro tip: get a lawyer to review it, especially for commercial properties. avoid getting caught out like sharmaji, who ended up paying hefty penalties because his agreement wasn’t properly stamped. plus, did you know agreements over eleven months need to be registered? save yourself future headaches, folks! jai hind!

unnormalised: Pro tip: Get a lawyer to review it, especially for commercial properties. Avoid getting caught out like Sharmaji, who ended up paying hefty penalties because his agreement wasn’t properly stamped. Plus, did you know agreements over 11 months NEED to be registered? Save yourself future headaches, folks! Jai Hind!
